decks.name: planets
decks.description: One question for each of the eight (sorry Pluto) planets in our solar system.

questions.front: A runaway greenhouse effect has made this planet unimaginably hot. It's known as Earth's sister planet.
This planet is closest to the sun, and is named after the messenger of the Olympians.
This planet is red and boasts the largest mountain in the solar system.
The largest planet, featuring a storm that's thrice the size of Earth and a 200-year-old stormy red dot.
This planet's enormous rings are 99% of why people like it so much.
This planet is blue, featuers a small ring, and is essentially sideways.
The farthest planet from the Sun, named after the Roman god of the sea (also the god of horses, believe it or not).

decks.name: minecraft blocks
decks.description: A handful of blocks from Minecraft. The correct answers are the ways to obtain these blocks in survival mode.

questions.front: How do I get a block of diamond ore?
questions.back: Mine diamond ore with a silk touch pickaxe

questions.front: What do I need to craft an enchanting table?
questions.back: Four obsidian, two diamonds, and a book.

questions.front: How do I craft diorite? I can mine it naturally, sure, but that's not important right now!
questions.back: Two cobblestone and two pieces of quartz

questions.front: How can I get gilded blackstone?
questions.back: Mine it with silk touch from a bastion in the nether.

questions.front: Where can I find wet sponge?
questions.back: In an ocean monument, although sometimes they can generate without it.

decks.name: spelunky 2 worlds
decks.description: Definitely not as popular as Minecraft, but I love this game a ton! These questions will present a fact or something, and ask for the relevant in-game location.

questions.front: I'm a horned lizard. Excluding the Cosmic Ocean, where am I?
I'm a proto-shopkeeper. Where am I?
